summary: The Northern Border Security Enhancement and Review Act (S. 850) amends the Northern Border Security Review Act. It mandates updates to the northern border threat analysis, including assessing apprehension changes.  It also requires the Department of Homeland Security to update its northern border strategy regularly, incorporating the threat analysis results. Furthermore, the bill calls for classified briefings to congressional committees on the analysis and instructs the Secretary of Homeland Security to develop performance measures for Air and Marine Operations' effectiveness. No additional funds are authorized.
